bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Peter W. Suarez, July 15, 1942

div1.p: Hench informs Suarez that he will return the Dominguez manuscript on Finlay to the publisher who loaned it to Hench. Hench explains his interest in yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Peter W. Suarez, July 15, 1942
div1.opener:
July 15, 1942
Mr. Peter W. Suarez
c/o American Car and Foundry Export Co.
30 Church Street
New York, N. Y.
My dear Mr. Suarez:
div1.p:
I am so sorry to hear of the death of Dr. Francisco Dominguez.
I had the pleasure of meeting him and talking to him at some length in the
Finlay Institute last year.

I am delighted indeed to know that some arrangements are going to
be made to publish in English Dr. Dominguez' interesting manuscript on Dr.
Dr. Finlay. I appreciated Dr. Dominguez' permission to see this manuscript.
Inasmuch as the Waverly Press loaned me this manuscript I think it best to
return it to them, and I will send them a carbon copy of this letter so that
they will expect to hear from you or Mrs. Dominguez directly. Please keep
me informed as to the progress made in having this manuscript published.
Permit me to send you by separate post a reprint which will explain in
part my interest in the wonderful story of the conquest of yellow fever.
I have had the pleasure of visiting Havana twice and of meeting Dr. Finlay's
son and family as well as other personages connected with the yellow fever
experiments.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
P.S. I find that Mr. Robert S. Gill, The Williams and Wilkins
Co. was the person with whom I had correspondence regarding this manuscript
and who sent it to me; therefore I am returning it to him.
Copy to Mr. Robert S. Gill
